intro: Gularia trilineata, commonly known as the three-lined gularia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Gularia trilineata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
